wikipedia_page.main: Professor Nigel Walker, CBE (6 August 1917 – 13 September 2014) was Wolfson Professor of Criminology at King's College, Cambridge.

response: Nigel Walker (born 15 June 1963) is a former Welsh track and field athlete and Wales international rugby union player.  He is currently National Director at the English Institute of Sport (EIS). He was born in Cardiff.

Philosophical Explanations was discussed by the National Review, Frederick Kroon in The Philosophical Quarterly, the philosopher Jim Holt in The American Scholar, the criminologist Nigel Walker in Philosophy, the philosopher Alvin Goldman in Philosophy and Phenomenological Research, and St Hope Earl McKenzie in Philosophy and Literature.
**Nigel Walker, 97, criminologist, Wolfson Professor of Criminology.
*Nigel Walker, 97, British criminologist, Wolfson Professor of Criminology (1973–1984).Professor Nigel Walker – obituary

Bala Reddy was born in Singapore on 18 September 1955 to parents who had migrated from Madurai, India. He graduated from the National University of Singapore (University of Singapore) Faculty of Law where he was conferred the Bachelor of Laws and Master of Laws degrees. He subsequently also qualified as a barrister in Singapore, Brunei, England and Wales. In 1991, he was awarded a Singapore Legal Service Commission scholarship to pursue an MPhil in Criminology at Trinity Hall, University of Cambridge where he was supervised by the distinguished criminologist, Nigel Walker. In 1999, Reddy was awarded a Legal Service sponsorship to join the Program for Management Development at Harvard Business School.
